items.sentence: I\'m glad you were able to go to Boston with Tom.
I ran into Tom this afternoon in the supermarket.
I remember meeting Tom at a conference in Boston.
I can\'t stand people who yell at their children.
I closed the door so that they wouldn\'t hear us.
Tom won\'t spend New Year\'s Eve with his family.
It\'s more fun to play baseball than to watch it.
Tom couldn\'t keep up with the rest of the class.
Tom couldn\'t make Mary understand what he meant.
Tom doesn\'t need to come if he doesn\'t want to.
Tom and Mary went outside to watch the fireworks.
Tom got upset when he found out Mary was leaving.
You ought to let Tom know that Mary will do that.
Didn\'t you know Tom and I often travel together?
Tom was fired from his job and his wife left him.
The doctor told Mary she couldn\'t have children.
I won\'t be able to tell you about what happened.
I\'m pretty sure they won\'t allow us to do that.
I have to help Tom do something tomorrow morning.
I have work to do, so go away and leave me alone.
I\'m pretty sure that Tom won\'t want to do that.
Tom wanted to take Mary in his arms and kiss her.
Tom wants to ask you some questions about French.
You should try to encourage Tom to do that again.
Tom woke up the next day with a painful hangover.
There\'s something important Tom didn\'t tell us.
I thought that you said that you weren\'t afraid.
Tom saw Mary looking at him from across the room.
Tom saw what he was looking for on the top shelf.
Tom never saw any wolves, but he could hear them.
Tom said he wasn\'t going to wait for permission.
Tom said he wasn\'t in the mood to do that today.
We arrived at the museum after a ten-minute walk.
We did a lot of singing and dancing at the party.
I\'d like to thank Tom for everything he\'s done.
Tom has a daughter that goes to school with Mary.
Tom has a hard time believing anything Mary says.
Tom has already been told that he has to do that.
I can\'t do this, so please don\'t ask me to try.
I can\'t find Tom. I think he must\'ve gone home.
I had no sooner sat down than the telephone rang.
Tom just shook his head and didn\'t say anything.
Tom knew he didn\'t have anything to worry about.
Tom hasn\'t come yet. He must\'ve missed the bus.
Tom hasn\'t yet done what we\'ve asked him to do.
I think Tom has been to Boston at least one time.
I think Tom needs to be told about what happened.
I think Tom should be able to do that by himself.
I think Tom was the one who cut down those trees.
I think Tom will want to talk to Mary about that.
